answers.answer: Tingling in the hands could be a sign of a peripheral neuropathy, a disorder which affects the nerves in the arms and legs usually. Diabetes is a cause of it, due to the damage a high blood glucose has on the nerves (although you said your diabetes is under control).There are many other causes of neuropathies including trauma, infections, metabolic problems, drugs and autoimmune damage.Hope this helped a bit.

question: I have tingling in both hand and have no strength in my thighs.  I can only walk very slowly stiff legged and can only go up one stair at a time.  Favor my left leg using the right leg in colapsed under me and I fell.  I have had 2 CAT Scans no heart problems or stroke problems.  I have had an MRI and an EMG haven't heard the results yet.  It started about 4 weeks ago hasn't gotten any better.  Loss of Temperature sensation in my fingers of my hand and my toes.I always feel cold.I have not been in any accident it just started about 4 weeks ago.  I am under alot of stress and have Diabetes, but it is under control.  A1C: 6.9.
title: Tingling in both hands and loss of strength in the thighs
